lead_paragraph: Ward Connerly, the University of California regent who touched off a statewide debate early this year by calling for an end to affirmative action in college admissions, now says he sees merit in some cases of preferential treatment for black and Hispanic students. "In January, I would have favored a total academic meritocracy," Mr. Connerly said last week, with students who had the best S.A.T. scores and grade point averages admitted to the university system.

headline.main: Regent Softens Stance on Affirmative Action
